formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Mifflin–St Jeor: Male: \( \mathrm{BMR} = 10\,w + 6.25\,h - 5\,a + 5 \) Female: \( \mathrm{BMR} = 10\,w + 6.25\,h - 5\,a - 161 \) where w = weight (kg), h = height (cm), a = age (years) Revised Harris–Benedict (Roza & Shizgal 1984): Male: \( \mathrm{BMR} = 13.397\,w + 4.799\,h - 5.677\,a + 88.362 \) Female: \( \mathrm{BMR} = 9.247\,w + 3.098\,h - 4.330\,a + 447.593 \) Katch–McArdle: \( \mathrm{BMR} = 370 + 21.6 \times \mathrm{LBM} \), with \( \mathrm{LBM} = w \times (1 - \mathrm{bf}) \) bf = body fat fraction (e.g., 20% → 0.20) Activity factor (TDEE): \( \mathrm{TDEE} = \mathrm{BMR} \times \mathrm{AF} \)
